document.docAuthor: Markevičiūtė, Radvilė, Podenas, Sigitas & Saldaitis, Aidas
document.masterDocTitle: New Antocha Osten Sacken (Diptera: Limoniidae) from Sichuan, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Antocha Osten Sacken (Diptera: Limoniidae) from Sichuan, China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Nature Research Centre, Akademijos str. 2, LT- 08412 Vilnius, Lithuania

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Caudal margin of tergite 9 nearly straight between two small bumps ( Fig. 3 ).............................
A. pallidella

– Caudal margin of tergite 9 gently emarginate and weakly crenulate, without two small bumps ( Fig. 4 )........
A. nigribasis

– Caudal margin of tergite 9 with two obliquely truncated median lobes ( Fig. 5 )..........................
A. emarginata

– Apex of gonocoxite narrowly elongated ( Fig. 6 )...................................................
A. fortidens

7 Outer gonostylus strongly bent ( Fig. 8 )............................................
A. nebulipennis nebulipennis

– Outer gonostylus arched, not bent ( Fig. 7 )...........................................
A. nebulipennis immaculata

8 Interbase well developed, appearing loop-shaped; paramere approximately as long as gonocoxite, appearing as slender, simple rod ( Fig. 9 )...................................................................................
A. bidens

– Interbase small, narrow to acute point; paramere shorter than gonocoxite ( Fig. 10 )..........................
A. bifida

– Aedeagus covered by wide parameral sheath ( Figs 15 , 16 ) or without parameral sheath and any lateral structures ( Figs 18–20 ) .................................................................................................. 13

– Lateral structures very slender, twisted into complete spiral turn at distal end ( Fig. 11 )......................
A. spiralis

– Lateral structure consists of three small branches ( Fig. 12 )..........................................
A. constricta

12 Outer branch of lateral structure approximately three times in length smaller than inner branch ( Fig. 14 )....
A . quadrifurca

– Outer branch of lateral structure very short, narrowed to acute point ( Fig. 13 ).........................
A. multidentata

14 Parameral sheath forms four horns ( Fig. 15 ).................................................
A. pulchra
sp. nov.

– Parameral sheath simple, without any structures ( Fig. 16 ).........................................
A. minuticornis

– Apex of outer gonostylus is gradually narrowed to acute tip ( Fig. 17 )..................................
A. lacteibasis
